articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A South Korean court on Tuesday approved an arrest warrant for President Yoon Suk Yeol, who has been impeached and suspended from power over his decision to impose martial law on Dec. 3, investigating authorities said.
articles.title: South Korea court issues arrest warrant for President Yoon

articles.author: Joyce Lee
articles.description: Experts said the embankment's proximity to the end of the runway defied best practices.
articles.title: Questions over airport embankment, bird strikes as South Korea air crash probed

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maytaal Angel, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Reuters spoke to four Palestinian men detained by Israel since the war’s outbreak. All were held for months, accused of affiliating with an illegal organisation, and released without being formally charged or convicted of any crime.
articles.title: Amid ceasefire push, Palestinians bear the scars of Israeli detention

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian gas supplies to Europe via Ukraine are set to end on New Year's Day, bringing down the curtain on Moscow's long period of dominance of supply in the European gas market.
articles.title: Europe's Russian gas era comes to an end as Ukraine transit stops

articles.author: Michel Rose, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Tuesday he recognised that his decision to call early parliamentary elections in June had created more political instability in the country, in a rare moment of contrition.
articles.title: Macron acknowledges error on early elections in New Year's speech

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States on Tuesday imposed sanctions on entities in Iran and Russia, accusing them of attempting to interfere in the 2024 U.S. election.
articles.title: US imposes sanctions on entities in Iran, Russia over election interference

articles.author: Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu got up from his hospital bed to call on unruly coalition partners to fall in line and back his government's 2025 budget after hardline rebels threatened to pull support for the bill.
articles.title: Recovering Netanyahu gets up from hospital to rally support for Israel budget

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin told Russians in a New Year address that the country would move forward with confidence in 2025, though he offered no specific promises on the economy or the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Putin tells Russians at New Year that 'everything will be fine'

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A U.S. military appeals court has ruled that plea deals related to the man accused of masterminding the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks and two accomplices can proceed after Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin had earlier moved to invalidate the agreements.
articles.title: US military appeals court says plea deals related to 9/11 attacks may proceed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ivory Coast President Alassane Ouattara said on Tuesday that French forces would withdraw from the West African nation, continuing the former colonial power's military exit from the region.
articles.title: Ivory Coast president says French forces to withdraw
